title: LU Decomposition: Solving Systems Efficiently
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll factorize a matrix and use LU decomposition to solve a system of linear equations.

workedExample.problemHtml: Solve the system of linear equations:\[\begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 5 \\ 3x - y + 2z &= 7 \\ 2x + 4y - 3z &= -1 \ \end{align*}\] using LU decomposition.

steps.explanation: We'll use row operations to transform the matrix into upper triangular form.
In this case, no permutations are needed.

steps.description: Transform the matrix to upper triangular form using elementary row operations
steps.mathHtml: \[ \begin{align*} R_1 ightarrow R_1 + 2R_2 - R_3 \\ R_2 ightarrow 3R_1 - R_2 + 2R_3 \\ R_3 ightarrow 2R_1 + 4R_2 - 3R_3 \ \end{align*}\]
steps.explanation: We'll eliminate the entries below the diagonal to get an upper triangular matrix.
The L matrix is the permutation matrix, and the U matrix is the upper triangular part.

steps.description: Solve the system by forward substitution

workedExample.finalAnswer: The solution is: x = 1, y = 2, z = 3
